rawData.title: Meta finally announces parental controls for teen AI use on Instagram
rawData.summary: Meta is introducing parental controls on Instagram that will allow parents to restrict or block their teens' interactions with AI chatbots, with features rolling out in early 2024 for English-speaking users in select countries.

rawData.title: Meta previews new parental controls for its AI experiences | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Meta is introducing new parental control features for teens' interactions with AI characters on its platforms, including the ability to block characters, monitor conversation topics, and set time limits, rolling out in early 2025 across select English-speaking countries.

rawData.title: The Bourbon Industry Is in Turmoil. Could Tech Provide the Shot It Needs?
rawData.summary: A new Kentucky distillery called Whiskey House is pioneering a high-tech, automated approach to bourbon production, using sensors and real-time analytics to ensure consistency while the broader industry faces declining sales and bankruptcies.

rawData.title: Anthropic connects Claude to Microsoft Teams, Outlook, and OneDrive
rawData.summary: Anthropic is integrating its Claude AI assistant with Microsoft 365 services, allowing it to access and analyze content from Word documents, Teams messages, Outlook emails, SharePoint, and OneDrive for enterprise users.

rawData.title: AT&T is raising home internet prices for the second year in a row
rawData.summary: AT&T is implementing a $5 monthly price increase on all home internet plans starting December 2025, following similar $5 increases in 2024 and 2023, though customers who signed up in the last year and low-income households will be exempt.

rawData.title: OpenAI pauses Sora video generations of Martin Luther King Jr. | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: OpenAI has suspended the ability to generate AI videos of Martin Luther King Jr. using its Sora platform at the request of his estate, following reports of disrespectful depictions being created by users.

rawData.title: Why world models are the next big thing in AI
rawData.summary: General Intuition, a new AI startup spun out from gaming platform Medal, has raised $133.7M to develop world models that help AI agents interact with physical spaces using gaming data, with initial applications planned for search and rescue drones.

rawData.title: MacBook Pro rumor points to OLED, touchscreen upgrades next year
rawData.summary: According to Bloomberg reports, Apple's 2026 MacBook Pro lineup will feature OLED touchscreens, a thinner design, and M6 processors, with prices expected to increase by several hundred dollars.

rawData.title: Amazon shares a ‘first look’ at new nuclear facility
rawData.summary: Amazon revealed plans for the Cascade Advanced Energy Facility in Washington State, which will deploy up to 12 small modular nuclear reactors by early 2030s, with the first phase generating 320 megawatts of carbon-free electricity.

rawData.title: New York bans AI-enabled rent price fixing
rawData.summary: New York has become the first state to ban the use of algorithmic pricing software by landlords for setting rental rates, with violators being considered as engaging in price collusion under the new law.

rawData.title: Nation-state hackers deliver malware from “bulletproof” blockchains
rawData.summary: Nation-state hackers, including North Korean groups, are using public cryptocurrency blockchains like Ethereum and BNB to store and distribute malware through smart contracts, making the malicious payloads immune to takedowns and costing less than traditional hosting methods.

rawData.title: Ars Live recap: Is the AI bubble about to pop? Ed Zitron weighs in.
rawData.summary: Tech critic Ed Zitron discusses the economics of generative AI, describing it as a $50 billion industry masquerading as a trillion-dollar one, while pointing to OpenAI's massive losses and unsustainable infrastructure costs as evidence of a potential bubble.

rawData.title: Kayak launches an 'AI Mode' for travel questions, search, and bookings | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Kayak has launched an AI Mode feature that lets users research and book travel through an integrated chatbot powered by ChatGPT, allowing natural language queries for flight deals, destination recommendations, and trip planning.

rawData.title: Unions are trying to stop Trump from kicking out immigrants over social media posts
Judge orders immigration agents in Chicago to use body cams
Why AI startups are taking data into their own hands | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: AI companies are shifting away from web-scraped training data towards carefully curated proprietary datasets, with firms like Turing and Fyxer directly hiring specialists to generate high-quality training data as a competitive advantage.

rawData.title: The real reason Google DeepMind is working with a fusion energy startup | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Google DeepMind is partnering with Commonwealth Fusion Systems (CFS) to use AI software Torax to simulate and optimize plasma behavior in fusion reactors, aiming to solve one of fusion power's biggest challenges - maintaining stable plasma conditions.

rawData.title: Niantic’s Peridot, the Augmented Reality Alien Dog, Is Now a Talking Tour Guide
rawData.summary: Niantic is adding voice capabilities to its AR companion app Peridot, allowing digital pets to act as tour guides and provide location-specific information through Snap Spectacles AR glasses.

rawData.title: Pinterest adds controls to let you limit the amount of 'AI slop' in your feed | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: Pinterest is introducing new controls that allow users to limit AI-generated content in their feeds and make AI content labels more visible, responding to user complaints about excessive AI-generated imagery on the platform.

rawData.title: Final 2 days to claim your exhibit table at Disrupt 2025 | TechCrunch
rawData.summary: TechCrunch Disrupt 2025, taking place October 27-29 in San Francisco, is offering final opportunities to secure exhibit tables for startups to showcase their innovations to 10,000 attendees including investors, founders, and tech leaders.
